Material is the metaphor.


A material metaphor is the unifying theory of a rationalized space and a system of motion. The material is grounded in tactile reality, inspired by the study of paper and ink, yet technologically advanced and open to imagination and magic.
 Surfaces and edges of the material provide visual cues that are grounded in reality. The use of familiar tactile attributes helps users quickly understand affordances. Yet the flexibility of the material creates new affordances that supercede those in the physical world, without breaking the rules of physics.
 The fundamentals of light, surface, and movement are key to conveying how objects move, interact, and exist in space and in relation to each other. Realistic lighting shows seams, divides space, and indicates moving parts.


Bold, graphic, intentional.


The foundational elements of print based design typography, grids, space, scale, color, and use of imagery guide visual treatments. These elements do far more than please the eye. They create hierarchy, meaning, and focus. Deliberate color choices, edge to edge imagery, large scale typography, and intentional white space create a bold and graphic interface that immerse the user in the experience.
 An emphasis on user actions makes core functionality immediately apparent and provides waypoints for the user.


Motion provides meaning.


Motion respects and reinforces the user as the prime mover. Primary user actions are inflection points that initiate motion, transforming the whole design.
 All action takes place in a single environment. Objects are presented to the user without breaking the continuity of experience even as they transform and reorganize.
 Motion is meaningful and appropriate, serving to focus attention and maintain continuity. Feedback is subtle yet clear. Transitions are efﬁcient yet coherent.


3D world.


The material environment is a 3D space, which means all objects have x, y, and z dimensions. The z-axis is perpendicularly aligned to the plane of the display, with the positive z-axis extending towards the viewer. Every sheet of material occupies a single position along the z-axis and has a standard 1dp thickness.
 On the web, the z-axis is used for layering and not for perspective. The 3D world is emulated by manipulating the y-axis.


Light and shadow.


Within the material environment, virtual lights illuminate the scene. Key lights create directional shadows, while ambient light creates soft shadows from all angles.
 Shadows in the material environment are cast by these two light sources. In Android development, shadows occur when light sources are blocked by sheets of material at various positions along the z-axis. On the web, shadows are depicted by manipulating the y-axis only. The following example shows the card with a height of 6dp.


Resting elevation.


All material objects, regardless of size, have a resting elevation, or default elevation that does not change. If an object changes elevation, it should return to its resting elevation as soon as possible.


Component elevations.


The resting elevation for a component type is consistent across apps (e.g., FAB elevation does not vary from 6dp in one app to 16dp in another app).
 Components may have different resting elevations across platforms, depending on the depth of the environment (e.g., TV has a greater depth than mobile or desktop).


Responsive elevation and dynamic elevation offsets.


Some component types have responsive elevation, meaning they change elevation in response to user input (e.g., normal, focused, and pressed) or system events. These elevation changes are consistently implemented using dynamic elevation offsets.
 Dynamic elevation offsets are the goal elevation that a component moves towards, relative to the component’s resting state. They ensure that elevation changes are consistent across actions and component types. For example, all components that lift on press have the same elevation change relative to their resting elevation.
 Once the input event is completed or cancelled, the component will return to its resting elevation.


Avoiding elevation interference.


Components with responsive elevations may encounter other components as they move between their resting elevations and dynamic elevation offsets. Because material cannot pass through other material, components avoid interfering with one another any number of ways, whether on a per component basis or using the entire app layout.
 On a component level, components can move or be removed before they cause interference. For example, a floating action button (FAB) can disappear or move off screen before a user picks up a card, or it can move if a snackbar appears.
 On the layout level, design your app layout to minimize opportunities for interference. For example, position the FAB to one side of stream of a cards so the FAB won’t interfere when a user tries to pick up one of cards.


User Profile Know Youre Body Relationships Family Planning HIV/AIDS AND STDs Reproductive Centers Myths And Facts References FAQ Terms and conditions About GENDER IDENTITY
Hello derrick! Sex Vs Gender Gender Identity KNOW YOURE BODY Understand your emotions Sex and sexuality fertility and pregnancy gender Identity Sex Vs gender image View
What is puberty
What are male reproductive organs What are sperms What is semen What are male hormones
Sex
 The term sex refers to biological characteristics, namely chromosomes, internal and external sex organs, and the hormonal activities within the body.
 Essentially, when we use the term sex, what we are really commenting on is “male” vs. “female”, scientifically speaking.
 The sex of an individual is based on genetics, making it much more difficult to change.
 For those who need a quick recap on human genetics, men and women both possess 46 chromosomes, as well as two sex chromosomes. Women have two X chromosomes, whereas men possess 1 X chromosome and 1 Y chromosome.
 It is this Y chromosome in men that causes the testes to form (as the Y chromosome is dominant). This difference in chromosomes also causes the variation in hormones that are found within the body.
 Women, for example, have much higher levels of estrogen and progesterone, which stimulate the body to develop primary and secondary sex characteristics (breasts, menstruation, etc.).
 Men, on the other hand, have much higher levels of testosterone than women. These genetically controlled factors result in the physiological and biological differences between the sexes.
Gender
 Gender describes the characteristics that a society or culture delineates as masculine or feminine. It is the role or differentiation that is created by the society.

 Unlike “sex”, gender does not have a basis in science, although it is affected by the biological and physiological characteristics we display as “males” and “females”.
. Instead, gender is based on the societal constructions and belief systems put in place that deal with masculinity and femininity. The gender identity that most people adhere to is usually unconscious or forced upon us at an early age.
 We see the concepts of gender in the colors assigned to children (blue for boys, pink for girls), the common length of our hair (men-short, women-long), the toys we play with, the jobs we aspire to, and the behaviors and interests we are “supposed” to embrace.
Gender Identity
 It is more about how do you identify yourself irrespective of your sexual organs.
 - If you have male sexual organs and you feel like a male, then your gender is Male
 - If you have female sexual organs and you feel like a female, then your gender is Female.
 - Sometimes,you may not identify yourself very clearly as one with a male or female gender or sometimes you could identify yourself as boy.
 Gender identity is different from sexual orientation
Puberty
 Puberty is a stage of transition from childhood to adulthood. All of us grow through this difficult stage with changes in our body and mind.
 It begins at different ages (from 12 years) depending on different people thus for some it starts early and others late. Common changes boys can expect include;
 • Enlargement of testes and the scrotum
 • Growth of pubic hair
 • Enlargement of the penis
 • Ejaculation. During sexual stimulation following a sexual act, the nerves around the penis send signals to the surrounding organs and a seminal fluid is released through the urethra.
 • Wet dreams. This is common among boys in puberty, they tend to wake up when the beds are wet. A boy can have a dream about sex and ejaculates.
 • Change in voice. The voice deepens.
Female reproductive organs
FEMALE HORMONES
 Hormones are the chemical substance that are released into the body by certain glands.The brain mainly controls their functione.
 They influence the behaviour, moods, and body changes.

 There are many hormones inour body.Some hormones are specifically responsible for female characteristics.
ESTROGEN
 it is a hormone responsible for female characteristics.

 In females who are not pregnant, estrogen is mainlt released from the ovaries.
 It also controls ovulation. The level of estrogen decreases during menstruation and increases during ovulation.

 In pregnant women, a large a mount of estrogen is also secreted from by the placenta inside the uterus.

 Some effects of estrogen
 • Increase in size of sexual organs
 During childhood, estrgen is secreted in small amounts, but the level increases in puberty.
 This causes all the female sex organs such as the uterus, ovary, fallopian tubes and external genitalia such as the vulva and vargina to grow in their sizes


• Enlargement of breasts
 Before puberty, both male and female breasts are smilar. But it is due to more production of estrogen in a female body, the breasts start growing in its size.


• Softness of the skin
 Estrogen is also responsible for the soft and smooth skin in a female
PROGESTRONE
 In females who are not pregnant, this hormone is only secreted after the ovulation by a structure medically called corpus luteum in the ovaries

 In women who are pregnant, large amount of progestrone is secreted by the placenta in the uterus


Effects of progestrone
 • Changes inside uterus
 progestrone helps to prepare the uterus for pregnancy after ovulation. It helps in sercretions and creating a layer inside the uterus for implantation


• Breast development
 It is also responsibe for enalarging the breasts.
FOLLICLES STIMULATING HORMONE(FSH)
 It is the hormone secreted by the pituitary gland in the brain. As the name suggests, it stimulates the growth of the varian follicles in the ovary before the release of an egg from the follicle during ovulation
LUTEINIZING HORMONE
 Pituitary gland in the brain secrets and contols most of the hormone in our body

 LH is one of the sex hormones produced by pituitary glands. In boys, it mainly controls the secretion of testosterone from the testes.

 If testes produce less testosterone, LH encourages the testes to produce more. If testes produce too much testosterone, LH controls testes to produce lesser testosterone.
Ovulation Menstruation Menstruation hygiene Common concerns about menustruation Myths about menstruation Challeges of adolescence Psychological development
Adolescence in females
 The teenage years are also called adolescence. During this time, the teenager will see the greatest amount of growth in height and weight.
 Adolescence is a time for growth spurts and puberty changes. An adolescent may grow several inches in several months followed by a period of very slow growth, then have another growth spurt.

 Changes with puberty may occur gradually or several signs may become visible at the same time.
 There is a great amount of variation in the rate of changes that may occur. Some adolescents may experience these signs of maturity sooner or later than others.
 It is important to remember that these changes happen at different times for everyone. Being smaller or bigger than other girls is normal as each child experiences puberty at her own time.
What is sex?
 Sex is defined as the activities you perform on yourself or with someone else that gives you a sexual feeling and pleasure.
 Sexual activities range from kissing, touching and the actual act intercourse. It can be fan but on the other hand, sex is concerned with huge risks.

What is sexuality?
 Sexuality is defined as the capacity of having sexual feelings or desires. Can also mean sexual orientation.
 Sexuality gives you the idea on sex (good and bad) but having these ideas does not mean one is ready for sex.

Delaying Sex
 Even though having sex is a personal choice, its good to have it at the right time when you are mature enough. So for one to have sex, they should be well conversant about the risks involved and how to prevent them.
 When you are young, mostly during puberty, many of us are uncomfortable with showing our bodies and private parts. This does not mean you are abnormal, it just means you are not ready to have sex. But do not worry, time will come when you are mature enough.

Wrong reasons to have Sex
 You should never have sex for the following reasons:-

 Because you are lonely, drunk, high.
 •Because someone else wants you to.
 •Because you think someone owes it to you or you owe it to someone.
 •Because of peer pressure i.e wanting to fit in a particular group.
 •Because you want to prove to someone that your grown up.
 •Because you think having sex will make someone love you or gain popularity and influence.
 •When you are afraid to say NO to a person.
 •When you think having a baby will make your boyfriend stay in your life.
 •When you want someone to return a favor.
 •When you want to hurt someone's feelings.
What is Sexual Intercourse?
 Sexual intercourse is the act of inserting the penis into the vagina that brings out pleasure and satisfaction for both women and men.
 When intercourse takes place without planning, there are higher risks of unwanted pregnancies and can also increase the risk of contracting sexually transmitted infections and HIV/AIDS.

Masturbation
 Masturbation is the stimulation of the genitals to achieve sexual arousal and pleasure, usually to the point of orgasm (sexual climax). It is commonly done by touching, stroking, or massaging the penis or clitoris until an orgasm is achieved. Some women also use stimulation of the vagina to masturbate or usesex toys,such as a vibrator.

 Who Masturbates?
 Just about everybody. Masturbation is a very common behavior, even among peoplewho have a sex partner. In one national study, 95% of males and 89% of females reported that they have masturbated.

 Masturbation is the first sexual act experienced by most males and females. In young children, masturbation is a normal part of the growing child's exploration of his or her body.

 Most people continue to masturbate in adulthood, and many do so throughout their lives.
 It becomes unhealthy when you start doing it all the time and can cause back aches but does not cause STIs nor pregnancy.
Sexual Orientation
 When one reaches puberty and on wards, sexual attraction grows and increases and it is natural and the gender you are attracted to defines the sexual orientation but it does not mean you are ready to have sex.

 Sexual Orientation is something you realize with in you and can not be forced on you. However, sometimes during adoloscence, you can get confused about your own body and also about your prefernce and feelings.

 • If you are attracted to the opposite sex, then you are heterosexual.
 • If you are attracted to the person of the same gender, the you are homosexual i.e lesbians (woman to woman) and gay (man to man).
 • If you are equally attracted to people of the same sex and opposite sex, then you are a bisexual.
Consent
 Sexual activities are extremely personal. Always respect yourself and your partner as well. One must take consent of the other person even for the act of kissing or touching their body parts.
 If the person says NO then its a NO, you should respect your partner's decision. Hence do not force the person physically or emotionally.
 Any sexual activity performed without the consent of the other person is considered sexual assault Sexual assault takes many forms such as forced sexual intercourse, kissing, hugging, touching, showing private parts to the other person, masturbating in front of people and verbally abusing someone in a sexual tone.

What is fertility?
 Fertility is the ability to reproduce and bare a child. Men who are fertile are able to produce enough healthy sperms to father children. On the other hand, women who are also fertile are able to get pregnant and carry the baby inside their uterus and then conceive nine months later.
 Chances of getting unwanted pregnancies increase when the sexual desires increase especially in youths from the age of 15 years to 23 years.
Causes of pregnancy
 Pregnancy can occur during varginal sexual intercourse when the man ejaculates or pre-ejaculates into the woman's vagina and the sperms meet the egg.
 Pre-ejaculating involves a small amount of sperms that can be released by the penis before complete ejaculation.

How one can avoid pregnancy
 The most certain way to a void pregnancy is abstinence (not engaging in sexual intercourse at all).Delay sex until you are ready and mature enough to deal with the effects of sex.
 The other way is the use of modern contraceptives correctly.

When can a female get pregnant?
 A woman can get pregnant any time of the month or in any phase of her menstrual cycle. One can even get pregnant if she has a sexual intercourse during menstruation.
 However, the chances of getting pregnant is much higher, few days before and after the time of ovulation.
 Younger girls (aged 8-9 years) can even get pregnant if they have sexual intercourse even before menarche, when the ovulation process has started.
How long does it take after sex to get pregnant?
 Pregnancy does not start at the time when sperm is ejaculated into the vagina. It can take up to 3 days for the sperm to meet the egg and fertilize.

 During these days, sperms travel to the uterus through the fallopian tubes, and then wait for the egg to release an ovary.
 It then takes another 10 days for the fertilized egg to attach itself to the lining of the uterus and this is called implantation. Pregnacy then starts after these processes.
 However, sperms travel very fast into the female body and cannot be cleaned or washed thus you cannot avoid HIV/STIs or unwanted pregnancy by just washing away the sperms.

What is fertilization?
 The joining of the egg and sperms is called fertilization. It occurs after a sexual intercourse when sperms are ejaculted into the vagina and meet the egg. Usually, out of a million sperms released, only one sperm meets the egg and gets fertilized.

What is Implantation?
 The fertilized egg moves down the follopian tube and divides into more cells, forming a ball. The ball of the cells reaches the uterus about 3-4 days after fertilization. The ball floats in the uterus for another 2-3 days.

 Pregnancy begins only if the ball cells attach to the ligning of the uterus and this is called Implantation.
 It usually starts about six days after fertilization and takes about 3-4 days to be complete. Up to half of all fertilized eggs never implant, they pass out of women's bodies during menstruation.
 If implantation takes place successfully, the attached ball of cells further divides to form the shapes and size of the baby along with the formation of the placenta.

How can one know if she is pregnant
 Missing the period would be the first sign of pregnancy.
 If ou have had sex, wether it is was protected with use of contraceptives or it was unprotected, if your period is late, always take a regnancy test. You will have to consul a doctor for further information if the pregnancy test turnes out to be positive

 If you get pregnant at a young age like in teenage, it is often risky for your health.


In such circumstances, you will have to inform your parents, or any elders you trust and must visit a doctor to discuss about further plans.
 There are many help centers tht can help adolescents and youth like you and they wont judge you and your information will remain confidential with them

 If you find out that you are pregnant and it was not planned, never ever do someting on your own or put something inside your vagina or harm yourself or your body. Always consult doctor as soon as you find out that you are pregnant
If a male does not ejaculate dring sexual intercourse,girl can't get pregnant.
 No, a woman can get pregnant because of the pre-ejaculated semen can contain sperms, so there are chances of getting pregnant even when sperms are not ejaculated into the vagina.
What is puberty in females?
 Puberty is a stage of transition from childhood to adulthood. All of us grow through this difficult stage with changes in our body and mind.
 It begins at different ages (from 9 years) depending on different people thus for some it starts early and others late. Common changes girls can expect include;
 • Enlargement of breasts.
 • Growth of pubic hair.
 • Change in body shape. Girls have lesser muscle mass and more fat mass than boys do, so during puberty many girls tend to gain weight, gain hips. It is a normal process though, so girls shouldn’t worry.
 • Menstruation. The first period in a girl’s life is called menarche, it may begin as early as 8 years to as late as 16 years. It is the time when a girl starts bleeding from the vagina for 4-5 days every month.
FEMALE REPRODUCTIVE ORGANS
 Reproductive organs are those organs in our bpdy that help in the process of reproduction.
 As these organs are also involved in sexual functions, they are also called sexual organs
 In girls, some reproductive organs are inside and some outside the body.
Vulva
 The vulval is made up of other reproductive parts among which include the following:-

 Labia
 Labia stands for lip in Latin language because it looks like lips. Labia covers rest of the vulva. The outer part of labia is medically called labia majora. It can be of different sizes and are usually darker in color. It contains the public hair on it.

 When a woman gets sexually excited, the outer lip(labia majora)swells up and color lightens.

 Inside the outer lip, there is another set of inner lip which is more sensitive and more pinkish in color. This inner lip is medically called labia minora


Clitoris
 The clitoris is located in the upper part of vulva. The inner lips of labia come together to form a hood or roof to cover the clitoris.

 It is the most sensitive sexual organ in a woman's body which is rich in nerve supply.

 It can vary in size from a size of pea to the size of finger-tip. It is comparable to the penis in male but with less function.

 The only function of clitoris is to provide sexual pleasure to female.

 When a female gets sexually excited, the clitoris gets firmer and bigger.


Urethre
 Many young girls get confused about where the urine actually comes out of.

 Many think it is the clitoris that passes the urine out.

 But actually the urine comes out from the urethre, which is a small hole that lies just below the clitoris.


Vaginal opening
 It is the opening that connects the outer sexual organs to the inner sexual organs.

 It lies at the point where the inner lips of the labia meet.

 It leads to the passage called vagina.
HYMEN
 It is a membrane that partly covers the vaginal opening from inside. In young girls, it could be intact. In later years in most sexually active women it may be absent or a small remnant may remain.

 However, even in young girls and virgins the hymen may have already been torn because of physical exercises such as cycling etc.

 Tearing of hymen is normal and it does not have any harmful effect on health.

 In many traditions people believe intact hymen is a sign of virginity is NOT true!
CERVIX
 In Latin, cervix stands for neck. So it is the narrow and the lower part of the uterus. It is the openeing of the uterus that connects t the vagina.
 This part is highly prone to cancer. In Nepal cancer of cervix is one of the most common cancer among women
BREAST
 A female breast is part of the reproductive system because it produces milk when a woman gives birth.

 It is a sensitive organ and touching it could also give sexual pleasure. As it is sensitive it can get hurt easily as well.

 The size of the breasts do not affect the milk producing capacity. It des not affect the sexual pleasure or sexul activity either.

 It is important for girls and women to take care of their breasts and do regular self-breast examination. Breast is a common site of cancer for most women.
What is Menstruation?
 It is the monthly bleeding that takes place at the end of a menstruation cycle.
 Following ovulation, if the egg doesn’t meet the sperm, it is not fertilized. In this case hormones drop and the inner lining of the uterus that was preparing itself for pregnancy begins to shed which causes bleeding.
 The blood travels through the cervix to the vagina and comes out of the vagina opening.
 The bleeding days and amount of bleeding vary from person to person.
MENSTRUATION HYGIENE
 It is very important for girls to have a good hygiene during menstruation i.e. keep the genitalia clean and dry during menstruation to prevent creation of room for bacteria and other microorganisms to grow which can lead to an infection.
 There are different menstrual hygiene products a girl can use and the include;
 • Sanitary pads.
 • Tampons.
 • Menstrual cups.
 • Reusable cotton clothes.

Common menstrual concerns.
 Most girls face emotional and physical problems during menstruation. And below is some detail of how to deal with it;


Premenstrual symptoms. 40% of women/girls experience it and does not have any specific characteristics though different people encounter different issues.
 Common ones are; irritability, mood swings and angry outbursts, feeling fullness in the body. One can cope up with these issues by; eating healthy food, physical activities such as exercise and sports and reducing the stress through having yoga classes.


Pain during menstruation. Most girls experience pain during menstruation because the uterus contracts to push out blood from it. This can be moderated by;
 • Having exercises such as walking to improve blood flow.
 • Having a healthy diet.
 • Applying heat to your abdomen with a heating pad or a hot water bottle can relieve the pain.
 • Taking a warm shower and having a massage can help relieve discomfort.


Irregular cycles. A normal cycle may vary from 28-35 days depending on an individual.
 In a young girl, there are lots of hormonal changes and the process of ovulation may not have been normal yet. Thus, it is common for young girls to have irregular cycles until the age of 21 years.
 Sometimes factors like stress, and lack of nutrition can lead to irregular cycles. Hence it is important to eat healthy and have regular exercises but if the irregularity persist, seek medical attention from a doctor.

A girl or woman is impure and dirty during menstruation, hence should not enter the kitchen or temples
 No! Menstruation is a natural process that indicates a healthy reproductive cycle and is not a judge of purity of cleanlness of a woman. However a woman is supposed to maintain hygiene during this period just like any other days.
 There is nothing wrong with entering the kitchen or having or having your faith in God during this period.
A girl or woman having periods should just take a bath on the fourth day of menstruation to purify her.
 No! A girl should take a bath everyday to maintain hygiene during menstruation or any other days.
A girl should never discuss about her periods with other males
 No, even men can provide help during menstruation such as counselling, be supportive. So both males and females are involved.
A girl or a woman should never touch a man during menstruation
A girl or a woman should not exercise during menstruation
 No, actually exercises and yoga help improve blood flow and do not harm your body.

A girl or a woman should not swim during menstruation
 No, one can do any activity she wants during menstruation just like in any other days. It is just that some sanitary napkins are not water proof, hence there will be some leaking.

Virgins should not use tampons
 No, tamptons serve the same purpose as sanitary napkins and do not have any negative effect on one's virginity. However, it is important to know how to use them correctly.

One must not have sex during menstruation because the menstruation blood releases toxins into the male body
 No, there is no problem having sex during this period as long as both parties agree on the issue since it is not hygienic.
 However, having sex during this period increases the chance of getting HIV and STIs as well as pregnancy.

What is Ovulation
 This is a time when an egg is released from the ovarian follicles in the ovaries with the help of different female hormones.
 The egg is released in the ovary and then travels to the fallopian tube and fertilization takes place if a sperm meets an ovum.

What are Male Organs?
 Unlike the female reproductive system, most of the male reproductive system is located outside of the body. These external structures include the penis, scrotum, and testicles.


Penis:
 This is the male organ used in sexual intercourse. It has three parts: the root, which attaches to the wall of the abdomen; the body, or shaft; and the glans, which is the cone-shaped part at the end of the penis.
 The glans, also called the head of the penis, is covered with a loose layer of skin called foreskin. This skin is sometimes removed in a procedure called circumcision.
 The opening of the urethra, the tube that transports semen and urine, is at the tip of the penis. The glans of the penis also contains a number of sensitive nerve endings.
 The body of the penis is cylindrical in shape and consists of three circular shaped chambers. These chambers are made up of special, sponge-like tissue. This tissue contains thousands of large spaces that fill with blood when the man is sexually aroused.
 As the penis fills with blood, it becomes rigid and erect, which allows for penetration during sexual intercourse. The skin of the penis is loose and elastic to accommodate changes in penis size during an erection.


Scrotum:
 This is the loose pouch-like sac of skin that hangs behind and below the penis.
 It contains the testicles (also called testes), as well as many nerves and blood vessels.
 The scrotum acts as aclimate control system for the testes. For normal sperm development, the testes must be at a temperature slightly cooler than body temperature.
 Special muscles in the wall of the scrotum allow it to contract and relax, moving the testicles closer to the body for warmth or farther away from the body to cool temperatures.

 Testicles (testes):
 These are oval organs about the size of large olives that lie in the scrotum, secured at either end by a structure called the spermatic cord. Most men have two testes.
 The testes are responsible for making testosterone, the primary male sex hormone, and for generating sperm. Within the testes are coiled masses of tubes called seminiferous tubules. These tubes are responsible for producing sperm cells.
What is Semen?
 Semen is a fluid that is ejaculated from the penis. It is white in color and mucus like in nature.
 It consists of fluid collected from the vas deferens, fluid from prostate and seminal vesicles.
 Semen contains sperm (reproductive cells), is expelled (ejaculated) through the end of the penis when the man reaches sexual climax (orgasm). When the penis is erect, the flow of urine is blocked from the urethra, allowing only semen to be ejaculated at orgasm.
What are Sperms?
 Sperm is the male reproductive cell. Boys start producing sperms from puberty.
 The testes produce up to 120 sperms per day and most of them are stored in the vas deferens.
 They can remain stored maintaining their fertility up to one month.
 During the storage, the sperms are in an inactive state and become active during ejaculation(after a sexual activity) and are capable of fertilization. when it meets the ovum. Only one sperm is needed for fertilization.
What are male hormones?
 Hormones are the chemical substances that are released into the body by certain glands and are mainly controlled by the brain.
 They influence the behavior, moods and body changes. Some hormones are specifically responsible for male characteristics and sperm formation and these include;


Testosterone
 Testerone is the hormone responsible for sperm formation. When a male baby is inside the mother's womb, testosterone is produced until puberty.
 These hormones are mainly produced by the testes in men. The secretion of testesterone is controlled by the hormones screted by piuitary gland located in the brain.
 This hormone is responsible for;
 •Enlargement of sexual organs.
 •Distribution of body hair.
 •Changes in the voice.
 •Muscle development.
 •Bone growth.


Luteinizing Hormone(LH)
 Pituitary gland in the brain secretes and controls most of the hormones in our body. LH is one of the sex hormones produced by pituitary glands. In boys, it mainly controls the secretion of testosterone from the testes.
 If testes produce less testosterone, LH encourages the testes to produce more.


Estrogens
 Boys secrete estrogens but in lesser amount and help in sperm formation.
 Follicle Stimulting Hormone (FSH)
 Produced by the pituitary gland and facilitates sperm formation.


Growth Hormones
 These are mainly responsible for overall growth but also help in sperm formation.
Signs of healthy and unhealthy relationships
Relationship with someone special
Relationship with friends
Relationship with parents and elders
Key to healthy relationship
Relationship
Relationship
 Adolescence and youth is the phase of life when you start exploring more about your relationships.
Relationship
 A key to successful friendship is being with the right company. So learn to choose the right friends as a youth because they have a bigger influence in your life.

 A real Friend
 • Someone you are natural and free with.
 • Someone yo do not work hard to impress.
 • A person with whom you share common interests and understands you.

 Do not have company with people that:- •bully you and disrespect you.
 •Force you into doing risky and unhealthy activities such as smoking, alcohol, risky sexual activities.

Key to healthy relationships
 The first step towards a healthy relationship begins from you.


Communicate.
 Communication is a fundamental aspect in a successful relationship and it helps both parties to understand each other very well. It is a two way thing where by both parties have to be involved so as to create a smooth relationship.

 Learn to listen.
 You should be able to listen to your partner no matter the circumstances and this creates trust.


Be honest.
 Always be faithful and truthful to your partner.
 Have a positive attitude.
 Always appreciate your partner and be supportive where necessary.

Relationship With Parents and Elders
 A relationship with your parents and elders may seem more complicated during this phase. In most cases, you think you are old and big enough to make your own decisions which may be rational.
 You tend to think everything they tell you is not important but in real sense, they are trying to protect you because you are precious to them and they love you.

Signs of Healthy and Unhealthy Relationships
 A healthy relationship with someone special be it your girlfriend or boyfriend must be mutual where:
 • Both respect each other.
 • Both parties respect and are honest with one another.
 • Both clearly communicate no matter the circumstances and express themselves.
 • Both have mutual consent for sexual activities and ready to go for an HIV test.

Relationship with someone special
 As we grow older, it is natural for us to wish we could be special for that one person. We also develop sexual feelings, feelings of intimacy and bonding with someone special. A healthy relationship is always comfortable and less complicated.
 Thus it is advised t have healthy relationships where;
 •You can be free and natural with someone.
 •You love and respect someone unconditionally.

Temporary Methods
Permanent Methods
Emergency Contraceptives
Others
Intrauterine contraceptive device(IUCD) or Intrauterine device(IUD).
 It is a flexible, small T-shaped tube that is inserted inside the uterus.
 It is effective for 12 years and is used by women who do not want to give birth for a long period. There are various types of IUDs and the most common one is copper-T.
 However, it requires a trained health worker, and can be accessed from a health facility.

Hormonal contraceptive implants.
 These are small tubes that contain a form of progesterone hormone in them. A trained health worker inserts the tubes under the skin of the woman’s upper arm. It is effective for 5 years.
 It releases the progesterone slowly into the woman’s body for a period of 5 years and prevents ovulation and thickens mucus in the cervix which prevents fertilization.

Contraceptive Injection.
 This is used by women who do not want to give birth for a long time. Just a single dose of contraceptive injection can prevent pregnancy for 3 months.
 The contraceptive injection is commonly known as DEPO based on the type of progesterone hormone it contains. It prevents ovulation and thickens mucus in the cervix which prevents fertilization.
 However, it must be used after consulting the doctor and requires trained staff.
Oral Contraceptive pills.
 These are pills that are taken by females through the mouth. It doesn’t prevent HIV or STIs! There are two types of oral contraceptive pills;
 Combined oral contraceptive pills. Most commonly used type. Contains two hormones called estrogen and progesterone. It prevents ovulation and thickens mucus in the cervix which prevents fertilization.
 Minipill or Progesterone pill. This contains only one hormone called the progesterone and is suitable for mothers who are breast feeding.

Condom.
 This is a commonly used method of contraception, acts as a barrier between the genitalia, prevents exchange of body fluids and entry of sperm into the vagina during sexual intercourse.
 It can prevent pregnancy, HIV and other STIs when used consistently and correctly for each and every sexual intercourse.

Temporary modern contraceptives.
 Temporary modern contraceptives. These are devices that can prevent pregnancy temporarily. It could be effective for one episode of sexual intercourse, a month, 3 months, 5 years or even 12 years depending on the type of contraceptive used.
 These methods are effective only if used correctly and are reversible in case one wants to get pregnant. These include;

Tubal Ligagtion
 This is a surgical procedure done in women, where the fallopian tubes are either tied or cut, so the ovum does not meet the sperm for fertilization.

Vasectomy.
 This is a major surgery done in men where the vas deferens are tied or cut. A man who had vasectomy will still have ejaculation but the ejaculated semen will not mix with the sperms thus prevent fertilization.
 However, after vasectomy, it is advised for men to have protected sex for a period of 6 months because the man will still ejaculate sperm in that period which may cause unwanted pregnancies.

Permanent Methods.
 These are methods that forever prevent pregnancy and is a choice of couples who never want to have children ever again.
Emergence contraceptives.
 Sometimes, one could forget to use other contraceptives before having sex and other cases, the condom may slip off or tear. In these cases, unprotected sex could increase the risk of unwanted pregnancy.
 There are methods that can be used within a certain duration after unprotected sexual intercourse that can prevent pregnancy. However, these methods do not prevent HIV/STIs. These include;
 • Contraceptive pills
 • IUDs
IUD
 It is effective for 12 years and is used by women who do not want to give birth for a long period. There are various types of IUDs and the most common one is copper-T.
 However, it requires a trained health worker, and can be accessed from a health facility.

Hello World from section:
PSYCHOLOGICAL DEVELOPMENT
 Just like your body, there are lots of changes in your emotions nd psychology during adolescence and youth


Some issues and challenges you notice at this phase of your life include the following:-
Hello blank fragment Female hormones
IDENTITY
 This is the time you start exploring your identity. About who you are and what you want to become in life.

 You start developing your own beliefs based on what your parents, your friends and the society around think and do.


Sometimes, you are inspired and influenced by your surrounding and sometimes you feel you do not fit in.


Sometimes, you may also begin to feel strongly about a religion and about your ethnicity. Sometimes you may not.


Don't worry, you can be very confused right now. You do not have to rush to take any serious decisions about your beliefs. Beliefs keep changing even when you become an adult.

 You will have clearer idea in few years about how you would like to identify yourself in different areas of your life.
SADNESS AND DEPRESSION
 It is natural to feel sad many times.You might feel like you don't fit in and nobody understands you.

 Sometimes, you might also feel depressed. If you find it is too difficult for you, you should always talk to someone.

 It is better to talk to your parents and teachers or other elders you feel comfortable with. It is always better to focus your energy in physical activities like sports, art and music, that would make you feel better. But even after you try your best, if you still feel

 -too sad

 -too many thoughts always bothering you

 -always feel like crying constantly

 -cannot sleep

 -don't feel like eating or eat too much
 You needto ask for help from your parents, elders and even professionals who can help you deal with difficult times.
SUCIDAL THOUGHTS
 Everyone of us at any age, at any point of life can feel very sad and depressed to the extent you start hating your life.
 Life is difficult for all, but there are also millions of opportunities and hopes.
 What bothers you right now will stop bothering you when you are emotionally strong and grow up a bit more. In few years you might even feel like laughing at yourself.
 If you have constant feeling of harming yourself or even kill yourself:

 -Do not rush

 -Take a deep breath and ask for help immediately from your elders

 -Do not hurt yourself

 You are too precious to be harmed by yourself or by anyone else

 Always remember you are special no matter whatt happened to you or what other people think of you.

 There are many professional health centers who can help you feel better. They will not judge you. They understand what you are going through. There are many adolescents like you who feel sad and anxious everyday. You are not the only one. Talk to your parent or elders.
SUBSTANCE ABUSE
 Adolescence is a time when you are at high risk of indulging in smoking, drinking alcohol and taking drugs.

 But once you take these steps, it is difficult for you to give up these habits. Even worse, you can easily get addicted. It can get you into wrong company and you may have trouble with the people you love.

 But you have a bright future ahead of you and you should not ruin it.

 So control yourself. Learn to say NO to substance abuse. Instead focus your energy on education,games and sports, art and music or whatever makes you feel really good inside.

 You can be happy and have fun even without these substances.

 In fact, you will be much happier without them.
EATING PROBLEMS
 It is common for many adolescents both boys and girls to have eating problems.

 As your body and mind is growing, it is important for you to have proper nutrition.

 If you are conscious of your body image and eat too little, it can lead to malnutrition and imbalance in your hormones affecting your normal growth.

 If you think you are not growing enough and eat too much, it will not help either, because it can lead to problems like obesity and can also affect your hormones and your proper growth.

 So try to have a balance diet rich in all the nutrients.

 Too much or too little food is not healthy for your growth.

 You should consult a professional nutritionist if you are having eating problems.
ANGER AND AGGRESSION
 At your age it is normal to get angry more often with your parents and elders.

 Anger is a natural emotion that we all have.

 But it is more important to learn to control your anger.

 It is not cool to let your anger control you.

 It is not cool to destroy things around you and hurt people.

 When you feel angry you can instead divert your anger and frustration into something productive like running, playing sports, playing music or painting or writing.

 This way you can channel all your negative energy into something more creative that you can be proud of.

 Many of us often laugh at the things that used to make us angry when we were younger. So don't worry it is a matter of time. Do not let aggression take over all the good things you have within you.
ANGER AND SELF ESTEEM
 Once you enter puberty and the days onwards, you notice sudden changes in your body and emotions. We all become selfconscious.We are concerned about what others think of us.

 In this process some may become extremely shy, some may loose their confidence, whereas some may try to gain too much attention from others.

 But the best solution is to stay cool.You do not need to worry about what your friends think of you because they are going through the similar stage as awkward as it is for you.

 You also do not need to worry what your elders think of you, bacause they too have passed through your stage.At your age they too have gone through their own awkwardness.

 So take it easy,relax and understand that you are still growing.Have confidence in yourself because no matter what others think of you, you are special.You will turn out just fine as a wonderful adult.
BODY IMAGE
 As we enter puberty our body changes rapidly.We all want to look attractive and are often influenced by the images of models and actors you watch in movies and magazines etc.On the other hand, you may feel that you do not look like them.

 Relax, we all have been through this stage.It is normal.Even the attractive adults you admire could have gone through same problems when they were younger.

 Remember, it is not the shape of your body,how fat you are or how thin you are that makes you attractive.Instead, it is the personality and the confidence you have in yourself that will make you attractive.
